      23             : /**
      24             :  * TextEventDispatcher is a helper class for dispatching widget events defined
      25             :  * in TextEvents.h.  Currently, this is a helper for dispatching
      26             :  * WidgetCompositionEvent and WidgetKeyboardEvent.  This manages the behavior
      27             :  * of them for conforming to DOM Level 3 Events.
      28             :  * An instance of this class is created by nsIWidget instance and owned by it.
      29             :  * This is typically created only by the top level widgets because only they
      30             :  * handle IME.
      31             :  */
      32             : 
      33             : class TextEventDispatcher final

      44             :   /**
      45             :    * Initializes the instance for IME or automated test.  Either IME or tests
      46             :    * need to call one of them before starting composition.  If they return
      47             :    * NS_ERROR_ALREADY_INITIALIZED, it means that the listener already listens
      48             :    * notifications from TextEventDispatcher for same purpose (for IME or tests).
      49             :    * If this returns another error, the caller shouldn't keep starting
      50             :    * composition.
      51             :    *

     298             : private:
     299             :   // mWidget is owner of the instance.  When this is created, this is set.
     300             :   // And when mWidget is released, this is cleared by OnDestroyWidget().
     301             :   // Note that mWidget may be destroyed already (i.e., mWidget->Destroyed() may
     302             :   // return true).
     303             :   nsIWidget* mWidget;
     304             :   // mListener is a weak reference to TextEventDispatcherListener.  That might
     305             :   // be referred by JS.  Therefore, the listener might be difficult to release
     306             :   // itself if this is a strong reference.  Additionally, it's difficult to
     307             :   // check if a method to uninstall the listener is called by valid instance.
     308             :   // So, using weak reference is the best way in this case.
     309             :   nsWeakPtr mListener;

     355             :   // While dispatching an event, this is incremented.
     356             :   uint16_t mDispatchingEvent;
     357             : 
     358             :   enum InputTransactionType : uint8_t
     359             :   {
     360             :     // No input transaction has been started.
     361             :     eNoInputTransaction,
     362             :     // Input transaction for native IME or keyboard event handler.  Note that
     363             :     // keyboard events may be dispatched via parent process if there is.
     364             :     eNativeInputTransaction,
     365             :     // Input transaction for automated tests which are APZ-aware.  Note that
     366             :     // keyboard events may be dispatched via parent process if there is.
     367             :     eAsyncTestInputTransaction,
     368             :     // Input transaction for automated tests which assume events are fired
     369             :     // synchronously.  I.e., keyboard events are always dispatched in the
     370             :     // current process.
     371             :     eSameProcessSyncTestInputTransaction,
     372             :     // Input transaction for Others (must be IME on B2G).  Events are fired
     373             :     // synchronously because TextInputProcessor which is the only user of
     374             :     // this input transaction type supports only keyboard apps on B2G.
     375             :     // Keyboard apps on B2G doesn't want to dispatch keyboard events to
     376             :     // chrome process. Therefore, this should dispatch key events only in
     377             :     // the current process.
     378             :     eSameProcessSyncInputTransaction
     379             :   };
     380             : 
     381             :   InputTransactionType mInputTransactionType;
     382             : 
     383             :   bool IsForTests() const
     384             :   {
     385           0 :     return mInputTransactionType == eAsyncTestInputTransaction ||
     386           0 :            mInputTransactionType == eSameProcessSyncTestInputTransaction;
     387             :   }
     388             : 
     389             :   // ShouldSendInputEventToAPZ() returns true when WidgetInputEvent should
     390             :   // be dispatched via its parent process (if there is) for APZ.  Otherwise,
     391             :   // when the input transaction is for IME of B2G or automated tests which
     392             :   // isn't APZ-aware, WidgetInputEvent should be dispatched form current
     393             :   // process directly.

     402             :         return false;

     405             :                    "there is no input transaction?");

     445             :    * StartCompositionAutomaticallyIfNecessary() starts composition if it hasn't
     446             :    * been started it yet.
     447             :    *
     448             :    * @param aStatus         If it succeeded to start composition normally, this
     449             :    *                        returns nsEventStatus_eIgnore.  Otherwise, e.g.,
     450             :    *                        the composition is canceled during dispatching
     451             :    *                        compositionstart event, this returns
     452             :    *                        nsEventStatus_eConsumeNoDefault.  In this case,
     453             :    *                        the caller shouldn't keep doing its job.
     454             :    * @param aEventTime      If this is not nullptr, WidgetCompositionEvent will
     455             :    *                        be initialized with this.  Otherwise, initialized
     456             :    *                        with the time at initializing.
     457             :    * @return                Only when something unexpected occurs, this returns
     458             :    *                        an error.  Otherwise, returns NS_OK even if aStatus
     459             :    *                        is nsEventStatus_eConsumeNoDefault.
     460             :    */
     461             :   nsresult StartCompositionAutomaticallyIfNecessary(
     462             :              nsEventStatus& aStatus,
     463             :              const WidgetEventTime* aEventTime);
     464             : 
     465             :   /**
     466             :    * DispatchKeyboardEventInternal() maybe dispatches aKeyboardEvent.
     467             :    *
     468             :    * @param aMessage        Must be eKeyDown, eKeyUp or eKeyPress.
     469             :    * @param aKeyboardEvent  A keyboard event.  If aMessage is eKeyPress and
     470             :    *                        the event is for second or later character, its
     471             :    *                        mKeyValue should be empty string.
     472             :    * @param aStatus         If dispatching event should be marked as consumed,
     473             :    *                        set nsEventStatus_eConsumeNoDefault.  Otherwise,
     474             :    *                        set nsEventStatus_eIgnore.  After dispatching
     475             :    *                        a event and it's consumed this returns
     476             :    *                        nsEventStatus_eConsumeNoDefault.
     477             :    * @param aData           Calling this method may cause calling
     478             :    *                        WillDispatchKeyboardEvent() of the listener.
     479             :    *                        aData will be set to its argument.
     480             :    * @param aIndexOfKeypress    This must be 0 if aMessage isn't eKeyPress or
     481             :    *                            aKeyboard.mKeyNameIndex isn't
     482             :    *                            KEY_NAME_INDEX_USE_STRING.  Otherwise, i.e.,
     483             :    *                            when an eKeyPress event causes inputting
     484             :    *                            text, this must be between 0 and
     485             :    *                            mKeyValue.Length() - 1 since keypress events
     486             :    *                            sending only one character per event.
     487             :    * @param aNeedsCallback  Set true when caller needs to initialize each
     488             :    *                        eKeyPress event immediately before dispatch.
     489             :    *                        Then, WillDispatchKeyboardEvent() is always called.
     490             :    * @return                true if an event is dispatched.  Otherwise, false.
     491             :    */
